item.title: Welcome to the Science and Computing blog
item.description:
Hello everyone, hope everyone is well!

I am creating this site with a focus on scientific dissemination, so make sure that we all win, you with first-hand information about science and computing. I will post on this site the main subjects about science and computing and I hope that everyone will collaborate with ideas and suggestions or even criticisms and opinions. Unfortunately, there are still many challenges to be overcome. To begin with, the scientific dissemination of what we can do in science with the aid of computing, that is, we will practically start from scratch to understand that computing also does science is not only used for the development and programming of systems. Furthermore, we are used to understanding that science can only be done in more traditional areas such as Biological Science, Chemistry, Physics, Medicine, among others. Something not so visible with computing. However, computing is used in several areas as a support to prove hypotheses that can become theories, through methods such as simulation for example.

Follow with us the development of our knowledge and help us spread science!

Hugs and thanks a lot!

item.title: About
item.description:
Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows.

Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including:

  • https://github.com/yuin/goldmark
  • https://github.com/alecthomas/chroma
  • https://github.com/muesli/smartcrop
  • https://github.com/spf13/cobra
  • https://github.com/spf13/viper

Hugo is ideal for blogs, corporate websites, creative portfolios, online magazines, single page applications or even a website with thousands of pages.

Hugo is for people who want to hand code their own website without worrying about setting up complicated runtimes, dependencies and databases.

Websites built with Hugo are extremelly fast, secure and can be deployed anywhere including, AWS, GitHub Pages, Heroku, Netlify and any other hosting provider.

Learn more and contribute on GitHub.
